perturbation.original_text: 1.6 "CUSTOMER(S)" means one or more customers of the Corio Services having its principal executive offices in the Territory who obtains a sublicense from Corio to use the Software or MarketSite.net Service, in the Corio Market Segment.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.6 "CUSTOMER(S)" means one or more clients of the Corio Services having its principal executive offices in the Territory who obtains a sublicense from Corio to use the Software or MarketSite.net Service, in the Corio Market Segment.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'customer' is replaced with 'client.' Although seemingly synonymous, this introduces ambiguity. Later sections might refer only to 'customers,' creating uncertainty about whether 'clients' are also included, especially concerning support or obligations.

perturbation.original_text: 1.1 "SOFTWARE USER" means a named user of the Corio Services worldwide to whom a user identification number and password has been assigned, which permits that user to access and use the Software on a designated Corio Server. The identification number and password used by a Software User is reusable and reassignable and may be used and transferred by Corio, in accordance with the licenses granted below, between Customers as one Customer discontinues the Corio Services and another Customer subscribes.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.1 "SOFTWARE USER" means a named user of the Corio Services worldwide to whom a user identification number and password has been assigned, which permits that user to access and use the Software on a designated Corio Server. The identification number and password used by a Software User is reusable and reassignable and may be used and transferred by Corio, in accordance with the licenses granted below, between End Users as one End User discontinues the Corio Services and another Customer subscribes.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Customer' is replaced with 'End User.' Although seemingly synonymous, this introduces ambiguity. Later sections might refer only to 'Customer', creating uncertainty about whether 'End User' is also included, especially concerning revenue or application management.

perturbation.original_text: 5.3 Support and Maintenance. Commerce One shall provide Corio with support described in EXHIBIT C hereto, and maintenance in the form of Updates and Upgrades. Corio shall be responsible for providing its Customers with routine technical support of the Software and MarketSite.net Service. Corio shall escalate any technical support questions or problems it is unable to answer or resolve directly to Commerce One for Commerce One's immediate attention and resolution under the schedule set forth in EXHIBIT C hereto. The support described in this Section 5.3 and EXHIBIT C hereto shall be provided to Corio but Commerce One shall have no obligation to provide any maintenance or support services to other third parties.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.3 Support and Maintenance. Commerce One shall provide Corio with support described in EXHIBIT C hereto, and maintenance in the form of Updates and Upgrades. Corio shall be responsible for providing its Subscribers with routine technical support of the Software and MarketSite.net Service. Corio shall escalate any technical support questions or problems it is unable to answer or resolve directly to Commerce One for Commerce One's immediate attention and resolution under the schedule set forth in EXHIBIT C hereto. The support described in this Section 5.3 and EXHIBIT C hereto shall be provided to Corio but Commerce One shall have no obligation to provide any maintenance or support services to other third parties.
perturbation.explanation: Replacing 'Customers' with 'Subscribers' creates uncertainty. Are 'Subscribers' the same as 'Customers'? This can lead to disputes regarding who Corio is obligated to support.
